intro: Mosquitoxylum, commonly known as the mosquito plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy, often glandular leaves. The plant is native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in tropical and subtropical climates. Mosquitoxylum species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
